alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Northwest Pocahontas; Northwest Randolph; Southeast Randolph; Taylor (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong, heavy thunderstorms impacting portions of Randolph, central Pocahontas, Taylor and Barbour Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 558 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong, heavy thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Philippi to Belington to 8 miles northwest of Snowshoe to 12 miles northeast of Richwood. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Elkins, Grafton, Philippi, Belington, Mill Creek, Dailey, Mingo, Beverly, Junior, Flemington, Womelsdorf (Coalton), Huttonsville, Montrose, Pheasant Run, Cheat Bridge, Knottsville, Glady, Bowden, Tygart Lake State Park and Thornton. This includes Route 33 between mile markers 31 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away. Find alternate routes. Move to higher ground.
